channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole in the middle of the road, 7th May
item.description:
There is a nasty pothole (after the long line of potholes) on the Hight St. It is on the west-bound side of the road. No paint around it, and it is hard for motorists to avoid as it is often in shadow and hard to see. It needs fixing, as does much of this road. It's like a 3rd world country standard road, a disgrace.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Channels dug across the road poorly filled in, 6th May
item.description:
Channels dug across the road have been repeatedly filled in badly and sink within a couple of days of refilling. They need sorting properly, this has been going on for months now, they are dangerous when sunk and damaging the vehicles. How many more times does this have to be reported before this issue is fixed???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely high grass and weeds blocking motorists vision., 6th May
item.description:
Grass verges along Finlay Way and verges and islands on Bishops Cleeve bypass have not been cut at all yet this year - despite other larger public areas of grass having been cut two or three times. These are now causing visibility problems for motorists as well as looking extremely untidy and uncared for. Tewkesbury Borough Council have always cut the verges up until this year. I have been informed by them that they are no longer taking responsibility for verges and Islands and that it is now for the land owner to attend to. They inform me that that is Gloucestershire County Council. Having left the grass for so long, when it is cut there will inevitably be a resultant mess - likely to block gutters and drains. When will Gloucestershire County Council take responsibility for completing this work and for maintaining the verges on a regular basis for the remainder of the summer - as local residents would expect?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finlay Way, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
